title: 6 Saint Hippolytus of Rome (ad 170–235) was a famous theologian and martyr of the early church. His Oratio de consummatione mundi ac de Antichristo, & Secundo aduentu Domini nostri Iesu Christi, was printed in numerous editions during the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries (Cologne, 1563; Paris, 1557 and 1656). 7 Pope (and Saint) Gregory I (c. ad 540–604) was Pope from 590 until his death.
